reviews.text:
Wrenbury railway station, serves trains that are either heading in the Crewe direction, or heading towards Shrewsbury (and beyond).

Right beside the railway station there is a small area for parking, that can accommodate up to about 3 cars. There is no designated disabled parking here.

There is also nowhere for anyone to leave their bicycle, because there is no bike rack at the station.

Both platforms do have a covered passenger shelter waiting area.

There is nowhere here to buy a ticket (for the train ride), so passengers would have to buy a ticket on board the train instead.

Both platforms do have a digital display which indicates when the next trains are due. 

There are no staff on site, and passengers must be reminded that if they want to get on a train they must indicate to the driver that they want the train to stop for them (otherwise the train will pass through without stopping).

All trains that stop at wrenbury railway station are operated by Arriva Trains.

It should also be noted that there are no signs of any closed circuit TV cameras in and around the vicinity.
